properties.name: Platformer Evaluator
properties.description: Show how to setup the platformer character jump height and predict its trajectory.

events.comment: Update sliders according to the platformer character position in the scene.
Draw the line that will follow the cursor objects.
Make additional trajectory data follow the trajectory drawing.
Update the platformer character initial speed according to the chosen maximum Y displacement for the jump (the PeakCursor position on the scene).
The trajectory drawing follows the character and stays still when he jumps.
Update the platformer character initial speed according to the chosen maximum Y displacement for the jump.
Update the points moving up or down at a given Y displacement.
Disable sliders when a cursor is used to avoid to move them when the cursor overlap them.
Update the platformer character configuration according to slider values.

It shows how to make an AI jump on a platform.

It uses the JumpDownTime expression to evaluate the duration it would take for the character to jump on the platform.
It's multiplied by the maximum speed to know at which distance from the platform to jump.
Make the character move in loop to try different settings.
The behavior configurates the platformer character to jump at a given height.
Update the UI
The behavior configurates the platformer character to jump at a given height.
Update the UI

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension can be useful for:
* Stick an accessory to a moving object,
* Animate a skeleton.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior to stick objects to other objects - so that they follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is stuck to another object.
eventsFunctions.name: IsStuck

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Stick the object to another. Use the action to stick the object, or unstick it later.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Sticker

eventsFunctions.description: Stick on another object.
eventsFunctions.name: Stick

eventsFunctions.description: Unstick from the object it was stuck to.
eventsFunctions.name: Unstick

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.

How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider

Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position

Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).

Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension allows to:
* Configure the height of a jump by automatically choosing the right jump speed.
* Know when to jump to reach a platform (can be useful for AI).
* Draw jump trajectories to check a level design.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PlatformerTrajectory
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Platformer character jump easy configuration and platformer AI tools.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Configure the height of a jump and evaluate the jump trajectory.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: PlatformerEvaluator

eventsFunctions.description: Change the jump speed to reach a given height.
eventsFunctions.name: SetJumpHeight
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the jump height of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Draw the jump trajectories from no sustain to full sustain.
eventsFunctions.name: DrawJump
eventsFunctions.sentence: Draw the jump trajectory of _PARAM0_ on _PARAM2_

events.comment: The trajectory with full jump sustaining
The trajectory without jump sustaining (impossible to do in practice as sustain happens at least one frame)

eventsFunctions.description: The jump Y displacement at a given time from the start of the jump.

eventsFunctions.description: The maximum Y displacement.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpPeakY

eventsFunctions.description: The time from the start of the jump when it reaches the maximum Y displacement.

eventsFunctions.description: The time from the start of the jump when it reaches a given Y displacement moving upward.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpUpTime

eventsFunctions.description: The time from the start of the jump when it reaches a given Y displacement moving downward.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpDownTime

eventsFunctions.description: The X displacement before the character stops (always positive).

eventsFunctions.description: The X displacement at a given time from now if accelerating (always positive).
